thread.title: Whitecaps' MLS winless run hits five games
thread.title_full: Whitecaps' MLS winless run hits five games - NEWS 1130

author: Rich Brown
title: Whitecaps' MLS winless run hits five games
text:
Summary Vancouver falls 2-0 to FC Dallas
Whitecaps lose in their final road game of the regular season
FRISCO, TX (NEWS 1130) – Michael Barrios and Mauro Diaz had goals for the home side as FC Dallas beat the Vancouver Whitecaps 2-0. The ‘Caps have three losses and two draws over their past five MLS matches.
After Barrios opened the scoring in the 32nd minute, Dallas had a chance to extend the lead with a penalty kick shortly before half-time. David Ousted dove to his right to stop Diaz from the spot and keep it a one-goal game.
Diaz would end up extending the lead about seven minutes into the second half though, as he beat Ousted on a single-handed effort.
The Whitecaps managed just a single shot on target in the defeat and it was turned aside by Jesse Gonzalez. They had six attempts miss the goal and three more blocked.
Vancouver (15W-5D-13L) can no longer earn the top seed in the Western Conference playoffs. The ‘Caps trail Dallas by four points, and Vancouver has just one game left. The Whitecaps host Houston Dynamo on Oct. 25 at BC Place.
